title: Man, 17, is arrested for attempted murder after bus driver is stabbed during 'robbery'
text:
A 17-year-old has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after a man was stabbed in Sheffield city centre.

The victim, who is a bus driver, was attacked at around 1.50pm today in Arundel Gate, Sheffield.

South Yorkshire Police have said that the driver was stabbed twice - in the back and in the leg - in what was thought to be a robbery.

A 17-year-old has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after a bus driver was stabbed in in Arundel Gate, Sheffield (stock image)

The force have since praised members of the public for their quick thinking in helping the wounded man and for holding the teenager at the scene.

The driver is said to be in a serious but stable condition in hospital.

Temporary Detective Chief Inspector Jamie Henderson said: 'Thanks to quick thinking actions of members of the public, the 17-year-old boy was detained at the scene until officers arrived.

The force have since praised members of the public for their quick thinking in helping the wounded man and for holding the teenager at the scene in the Arundel Gate area

'Their brave actions meant that we were able to take control of the situation quickly, get the offender into custody and the victim to hospital.

'I'd like to thank everyone who assisted.

'At this time, we believe this was an attempted robbery which has escalated and officers are in the area carrying out enquiries to ascertain exactly what happened.

'They will be there for the rest of the afternoon, with increased patrols into the evening for your reassurance.'
description: The driver was attacked at around 1.50pm today in Arundel Gate, Sheffield. He was stabbed twice - in the back and in the leg - and is now said to be in a serious but stable condition in hospital.
